jktest.logutil module¶

This module contains utilities for post-processing the output log

class jktest.logutil.Tee(*files)¶

Bases: object

Public Class

Instantiations of this class are used to set the sys.stdout. By specifying multiple files, or sys.__stdout__, can redirect stdout to multiple targets.

Typical usage is to specify a file and the sys.__stdout__ to write to both a file and the console.

f = open(‘somefile.log’, ‘w’) sys.stdout = Tee( sys.__stdout__, f )

Constructor

Parameters:*files (<_io.TextIOWrapper>) – any number of stdout objects to write output to
closeFiles()¶

Public Method

This method attempts to close any files that may have been opened. Catches and passes all exceptions.

Returns:n/a:
flush()¶

Public Method

Implementation of the TextIOWrapper flush method. Typically not explicitly called, but rather provides the method for stdout to access.

Returns:n/a:
write(obj)¶

Public Method

Implementation of the TextIOWrapper write method. Typically not explicitly called, but rather provides the method for stdout to access.

Parameters:obj – Any object type that implements write() for stdout
Returns:n/a:
jktest.logutil.closeLog()¶

Public Function

Closes the log file, if it were opened. Restores the stdio back to the console.

Returns:n/a:
jktest.logutil.jkindVersion()¶

Public Function

Gets the jkind version string.

Return type:string
jktest.logutil.openLog()¶

Public Function

Opens the log file, if one was specified. If so will direct the stdio to both the file and to the console. If no file, then just to the console.

Returns:The opened file if available otherwise None
Return type:file or None
jktest.logutil.splitLog(logfile)¶

Public Function

Given a log file, this function will parse and write out the individual lustre results to a like-named text file. These files are saved in a sub-folder with the same name as the original log file.

Parameters:logfile (str) – Fully qualified filename of the log file to parse.
Returns:n/a:
